hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Extreme Reversion Post-News Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: When ETH/BTC 24-hour price ratio moves >3.5% from its 20-day rolling average following news events, it will revert >50% of that deviation within 48 hours, regardless of regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Cross-asset ratio spikes driven by news often overestimate fundamental shifts. Market makers and arbitrageurs correct temporary dislocations, especially in highly correlated assets like ETH/BTC.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC ratio deviates >3.5% from its 20-day SMA
Deviation occurs within 4 hours of identifiable news event (categorized by NLP sentiment)
Entry on next hourly close after condition met

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio reverts 50% of initial deviation OR 1.8% gain on the trade
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio continues moving against position by 1.2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 52% of trades are profitable across 30+ instances, or average win/loss ratio < 1.3.
